hook.text: A coach asked: what would you do differently next time? The player's own answer was better than any lecture.

buildup.text: Telling people what to fix creates resistance. Asking them what they noticed creates ownership.

discovery.text: Self-generated insight sticks better than imposed advice. People act on their own conclusions.

twist.text: The best feedback isn't a monologue. It's a conversation that helps the other person think.

climax.text: Try: how did you think that went? What would you change? You'll be surprised how self-aware people are.

punchline.text: Ask first. You might not even need to tell.

quiz.question: Why is asking questions more effective than telling in feedback?
options: Self-generated insights create more ownership and stick better
People cannot handle being told what to improve directly
Asking questions avoids any responsibility on the manager's part
